ygData.subject: RE: what should i be looking for now?
ygData.msgSnippet: Head toCazic Thule for cash.  I know it is probably heavily populated, but you can get alot of FS weapons from the defenders and sentinels which should still
ygData.messageBody:
Head toCazic Thule for cash. I know it is probably heavily populated, but
you can get alot of FS weapons from the defenders and sentinels which should
still give you experiece as well. The warders will carry FS also. Just get
yourself with a cleric and pull ones and twos from the tunnels and "try" to
get the ones that have FS. I have made over 100 plat a night in that place
with just a few hours worth of work. And that was during crowded time
periods.

Also, the temple at th end of the maze is a GREAT place for cash/exp. But
you should have a pretty good group to go into that area. Definitely have a
well rounded group i.e. 2 healer/2tank/2nuker. You will gain xp and cash
very fast in that area.

As far as weapons are concerned. Try to get yourself a demons claw and
tentacle whip. The PGT is nice, but the knock to your agi is terrible when
the bezerker strength goes off. The VERY low speed/damage on these items
allows for non-stop attacks. For armor... I would recommend saving your
cash for Steel plate until you can get into some rubi/mithril/silvered. I
had similiar problems with people constantly camping the rubicite so i
decided while they were sitting there gaining nothing but wasting a tone of
time. I would just spend my time reaping cash/xp from the lizards and buy
my armor. Also get as much bronze as you can in the mean time wihthout
spend alot of time/money doing it.

Another good money pit is solusek a. You should be able to go there with a
well balanced group and get around pretty well. Be wary of the traps and
get mobbed by hordes thoug. Everytime I head to a place like that i have a
druid or wiz that can group gate or succor us out in an emergency (they
always happen *grin).

Dyvim Kincaid
Warrior of Cazic Thule.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Dan Leavy [mailto:dan@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 9:21 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] what should i be looking for now?
>
>
> From: Dan Leavy <dan@...>

> thanks for the advice....comments below
>
> David Rogers wrote:
>
> > From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
> >
> > --- Dan Leavy <dan@...> wrote:
> > > level 30 dwarf warrior
> > >
> > > PGT
> > > dragoon dirk
> > > SBH
> > > elm recurve bow => Ash or Oak as you like it set
> > up. ---
>
> yep yep...need better bow!
>
>
>
> >
> > > +1 str earrings => Gold-Amber (+3 STR) - these would be cool )
> > > collar of undead prot => Spiked Collar (+3 STR) - ive got a spiked
> > collar but went in favour of the undead one...with better AC
>
> >
> > > blackened helm => Bronze Helm or B.Iron Crown --- sorry i
> menat B iron
> > crown, not blackened helm
>
>
>
> >
> > > grotesque mask
> > > BS mantle
> > > bronze tunic
> > > barbed arms => Bronze Arms --- my barbed arms are only 1 ac
> less than
> > bronze, but give +2 dex
>
>
>
> >
> > > bronze bracers => Bracers of Battle --- yeah ill have to look for
> > these...was also thinking of erollisi bracer
>
> >
> > > lizardscale cloak => Bronze Cloak --- lizard is same Ac as bronze but
> > lighter and plus 5 dex
> > > bronze pants
> > > blackened boots => Bronze or Dwarven Work Boots --- dwarven
> boots would
> > be real cool...but they are so sought after and rare...i prefer
> the black
> > ones over bronze as i can kick magic with them.
>
>
>
> >
> > > +5 agi rings
> > > jboots => Or just wear these all the time. - -- i just leave these in
> > an inventory slot as i dont need to wear them for the sow
> effect..only ac
> > 1
>
> >
> >
> > Question about the Journeyman's Boots. Do they
> > enhance your speed just by wearing them, or do you
> > have to burn a SOW charge out of them to get a speed
> > increase?
>
> they just need to be in a main inventory slot, then you right
> click on them
> to get the sow...and they have unlimited charges...sow can only be cast
> outdoors and lasts 20 mins...but you can cast on the move as well...
>
>
> >
> >
> > Go all bronze on your character and start working on
> > Rubicite or Mithril/Silvered Plate. Any items you're
> > wearing that are chain equalivalent are holding you
> > back; plate is a requirement to do really, really well
> > at higher levels in melee.
>
> yeah would love to go for rubi...mithril or silvered...just they
> are all so
> camped...
>
> i also only have about 300pp in the bank...i think this is way below what
> most seem to have at level 30!! so im also trying to find a good place to
> sit for hours and just gather plat and not worry about exp.
>
> thanks again
> Dan
